summary.content: An access control vulnerability was discovered in the Request Trace and Download Trace functionalities due to a specific access restriction not being properly enforced for users with limited privileges.

entry.title: Incorrect authorization for traces request/download in CMC before 25.1.0

summary.content: A privilege escalation vulnerability may enable a service account to elevate its privileges.

entry.title: Privilege escalation in Guardian/CMC before 24.6.0

summary.content: An OS command injection vulnerability within the update functionality may allow an authenticated administrator to execute unauthorized arbitrary OS commands.

entry.title: Authenticated RCE in update functionality in Guardian/CMC before 24.6.0

summary.content: An access control vulnerability was discovered in the Reports section due to a specific access restriction not being properly enforced for users with limited privileges.

entry.title: Incorrect authorization for Reports configuration in Guardian/CMC before 24.2.0

summary.content: A Denial of Service (Dos) vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian, caused by improper input validation in certain fields used in the Radius parsing functionality of our IDS, allows an unauthenticated attacker sending specially crafted malformed network packets to cause the IDS module to stop updating nodes, links, and assets.

entry.title: DoS on IDS parsing of malformed Radius packets in Guardian before 23.4.1

summary.content: A SQL Injection vulnerability has been found in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC, due to improper input validation in certain parameters used in the Query functionality.

entry.title: Authenticated SQL Injection on Query functionality in Guardian/CMC before 22.6.3 and 23.1.0

summary.content: In certain conditions, depending on timing and the usage of the Chrome web browser, Guardian/CMC versions before 22.6.2 do not always completely invalidate the user session upon logout. Thus an authenticated local attacker may gain acces to the original user's session.

entry.title: Session Fixation in Guardian/CMC before 22.6.2

summary.content: An authenticated administrator can upload a SAML configuration file with the wrong format, with the application not checking the correct file format. Every subsequent application request will return an error.

entry.title: DoS via SAML configuration in Guardian/CMC before 22.6.2

summary.content: A partial DoS vulnerability has been detected in the Reports section, exploitable by a malicious authenticated user forcing a report to be saved with its name set as null.

entry.title: Partial DoS on Reports section due to null report name in Guardian/CMC before 22.6.2

summary.content: An authenticated attacker with administrative access to the web management interface can inject malicious JavaScript code inside the definition of a Threat Intelligence rule, that will be stored and can later be executed by another legitimate user viewing the details of such a rule.

entry.title: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in Threat Intelligence rules in Guardian/CMC before 22.6.2

summary.content: A blind SQL Injection vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC, due to improper input validation in the alerts_count component, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary SQL statements on the DBMS used by the web application.

entry.title: Authenticated Blind SQL Injection on alerts count in Guardian/CMC before 22.6.2

summary.content: A blind SQL Injection vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC, due to improper input validation in the sorting parameter, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary SQL statements on the DBMS used by the web application.

entry.title: Authenticated Blind SQL Injection on sorting in Guardian/CMC before 22.6.2

summary.content: Audit records for OpenAPI requests may include sensitive information.

entry.title: Information disclosure via audit records for OpenAPI requests in Guardian/CMC before 23.4.1

summary.content: On Windows systems, the Arc configuration files resulted to be world-readable.

entry.title: Sensitive data exfiltration via unsafe permissions on Windows systems in Arc before v1.6.0

summary.content: A missing authentication check in the WebSocket channel used for the Check Point IoT integration in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC, may allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain assets data without authentication.

entry.title: Check Point IoT integration: WebSocket returns assets data without authentication in Guardian/CMC before 23.3.0

summary.content: A SQL Injection vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC, due to improper input validation in certain fields used in the Asset Intelligence functionality of our IDS, may allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary SQL statements on the DBMS used by the web application by sending specially crafted malicious network packets.

entry.title: SQL Injection on IDS parsing of malformed asset fields in Guardian/CMC >= 22.6.0 before 22.6.3 and 23.1.0

summary.content: A Denial of Service (Dos) vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC, due to improper input validation in certain fields used in the Asset Intelligence functionality of our IDS, allows an unauthenticated attacker to crash the IDS module by sending specially crafted malformed network packets.

entry.title: DoS on IDS parsing of malformed asset fields in Guardian/CMC >= 22.6.0 before 22.6.3 and 23.1.0

summary.content: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in project file upload in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC allows an authenticated attacker with admin or import manager roles to execute unattended commands on the appliance using web server user privileges.

entry.title: Authenticated RCE on project configuration import in Guardian/CMC before 22.0.0

summary.content: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in custom report logo upload in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC allows an authenticated attacker with admin or report manager roles to execute unattended commands on the appliance using web server user privileges.

entry.title: Authenticated RCE on logo report upload in Guardian/CMC before 22.0.0

summary.content: An access control vulnerability was found, due to the restrictions that are applied on actual assertions not being enforced in their debug functionality.

entry.title: Information disclosure via the debug function in assertions in Guardian/CMC before 22.6.2

summary.content: Multiple functions use archives without properly validating the filenames therein, rendering the application vulnerable to path traversal via 'zip slip' attacks.

entry.title: Path traversal via 'zip slip' in Arc before v1.6.0

summary.content: On Unix systems (Linux, MacOS), Arc uses a temporary file with unsafe privileges.

entry.title: Unsafe temporary data privileges on Unix systems in Arc before v1.6.0

summary.content: When configuring Arc (e.g. during the first setup), a local web interface is provided to ease the configuration process. Such web interface lacks authentication and may thus be abused by a local attacker or malware running on the machine itself.

entry.title: Missing authentication for local web interface in Arc before v1.6.0

summary.content: A SQL Injection vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC, due to improper input validation in the Alerts controller, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary SQL queries on the DBMS used by the web application.

entry.title: Authenticated SQL Injection on Alerts in Guardian/CMC before 22.5.2

summary.content: An authenticated command path traversal vulnerability in the management interface allows an authenticated administrator to read-protected system files.

entry.title: Authenticated command path traversal on timezone settings in Guardian/CMC before 20.0.7.4

summary.content: An OS command injection vulnerability in the management interface allows an authenticated administrator to execute arbitrary OS commands gaining access to the system.

entry.title: Authenticated command injection when changing date settings or hostname in Guardian/CMC before 20.0.7.4

summary.content: Report name field is affected by angular template injection which can lead to XSS attacks.

entry.title: Angular template injection on custom report name field

summary.content: Change password doesn't validate CSRF token properly.

entry.title: Cross-site request forgery attack on change password form

summary.content: CSV Injection, also known as Formula Injection, occurs when websites embed untrusted input inside CSV files. An authenticated malicious user can insert a crafted formula in the node label that can be later executed on another system after another user has downloaded and opened the node list export.

entry.title: CSV Injection on node label

summary.content: An attacker with admin access to the appliance can inject malicious code that will later be executed by another legitimate users. This allows an attacker to perform unauthorized actions on behalf of legitimate users. JavaScript injection was possible using the field name when adding new column to the data model section. The injected code will then be executed in the environment section under e.g. asset view.

entry.title: Stored XSS in field name data model
